ConfigurationÔÉÅ

The format of primary and automatic tags in a template, together with other settings, can be configured by the configuration object of the BlockConfig class.

The configuration object attributes define the format of primary tags using functions defining how a template tag string is generated from a tag name. The most straightforward way to define these tag generators is to use the lamba functions.

The configuration object contains also attributes defining the symbols used for the automatic tags, and a tabulator size attribute used by the alignment autotag when tabulators are used for the alignment.

The following example of a block configuration object uses the at sign @ as a primary tag symbol:

config = BlockConfig(
    lambda name: f"@{name}",    # tag_gen_var
    lambda name: f"@{name}",    # tag_gen_blk_start
    lambda name: f"@!{name}",   # tag_gen_blk_end
    lambda name: f"@~{name}",   # tag_gen_blk_vari
    "*",                        # autotag_align
    "_",                        # autotag_vari
    8                           # tab_size
)

The template tags configured by the configuration object above have the following format:

  • Variable: @name.

  • Block start: @name.

  • Block end: @!name.

  • Block variation separator: @~name.

  • Alignment autotag: @*.

  • Variation autotag: @_.

The configuration object config can then be assigned to the primary Block object in its constructor Block.__init__() as illustrated below:

blk = Block(template, config=config)

Alternatively, the configuration object can be assigned directly to the Block.config attribute.

All child blocks of a configured block will automatically use the same configuration.
